english.segment1: You make me drunk like dad's whisky. When I was thirteen years old. Now I've got my nose pressed down on the table. Like I'm waiting for him to come home
english.segment2: My thought's keep rolling like boulders. Sharp off the tip of my tongue. I know he'd say Son, you're a man, stop crying. But daddy I still feel so young
english.segment3: Hold me, I will hold you back. Nothing but the chill will let you go
english.segment4: Outside the rust just keeps building. Around the gate of my fence. Last time I checked it was you I was mending. And nothing else needed me since
english.segment5: Over the streets in the city. Winter is bringing her chill. I hear her calling at the top of the chimney. But I'm not inviting her in
english.segment6: Hold me, I will hold you back. Nothing but the chill will let you go. Love me, I will love you back. Nothing but the chill will let you go. There's no way I'm ever letting go
